Key Arguments: The proposed legislation gives too much power to unelected bureaucrats to determine what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
The government and bureaucratic bodies have themselves been sources of misinformation, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Individuals are capable of discerning correct information without government intervention.
The legislation is seen as an overreach and a threat to free speech, likened to a move towards communism.
Distrust in government and its ability to regulate information effectively.
Notable Quotes: Have we become a communist state already? If not, we are certainly on the fast track to be one!
